column1: '''Trewsday''' (archaic form ''Trewesdei'') was the fourth day of the week in the [[Shire Calendar]]. It represented the [[Númenórean]] day ''[[Orgaladh]]''
column2: originally dedicated to the tree [[Nimloth of Númenor|Nimloth]].<ref name=cal>{{App|Calendars}}</ref>

column1: After the reform of [[Isengrim Took II]]
column2: <ref name=cal/> dates such as [[1 February]] and [[1 August]] always fell on Trewsday.
a word preserved in the [[Yellowskin]].<ref name=cal/>

column1: ''Trewsday'' is translated as "Tuesday " in ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''.<ref name=cal/>
